overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="5.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> The student uses the data collected from the experiment to create the data table. Which of the following statements is true regarding the data?

choices.label: The momentum of the two-block system is conserved because the initial momentum of block <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is experimentally consistent for all trials.

The momentum of the two-block system is conserved because the final momentum of block <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></math> is experimentally consistent for all trials.
The momentum of the two-block system is not conserved because the initial momentum of the system is not equal to the final momentum of the system.
The level of error associated with the data is too high to make a conclusion regarding the momentum of the individual blocks and the system.

content.answer: The momentum of the two-block system is not conserved because the initial momentum of the system is not equal to the final momentum of the system.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
